thread.title: 'You'd LOSE' Kay Burley hammers Salmond over threat to call second independence referendum
thread.title_full: 'You'd LOSE' Kay Burley hammers Salmond over threat to call second independence referendum

title: 'You'd LOSE' Kay Burley hammers Salmond over threat to call second independence referendum
text:
'You'd LOSE' Kay Burley hammers Salmond over threat to call second independence referendum 'You'd LOSE' Kay Burley hammers Salmond over threat to call second independence referendum KAY BURLEY ripped into Alex Salmond after he warned of a second Scottish independence referendum if Theresa May failed to compromise with the SNP over Brexit. PUBLISHED: 22:26, Tue, Jan 17, 2017 | UPDATED: 22:27, Tue, Jan 17, 2017 
Speaking on Sky News , the former First Minister spoke of the compromise proposals set out by Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon before Christmas, urging the Government to remain members of the single market. 
After the Prime Minister’s landmark speech on Monday confirming the UK would seek to leave the trading bloc, the Gordon MP said a second referendum on Scottish independence would become “overwhelmingly likely” if Mrs May refused to give Scotland a “special deal”. 
He asked: “There’s special deals and accommodations all over the place, why shouldn’t there be one for Scotland?” 
But the news anchor offered a brutal response and said: “Because if you held a second referendum, there isn’t an appetite for it in Scotland and you’d lose.” SKY NEWS Kay Burley and Alex Salmond clash over Brexit and Scottish independence Related articles
